Author: TA427, a.k.a. Emerald Sleet, APT43, THALLIUM or Kimsuky.
Target: Foreign policy experts for insight into US and the Republic of Korea
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint reveal the details of a campaign orchestrated by threat actors aligned with North Korea and targeting foreign policy experts for insight into US and the Republic of Korea.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers from Fortinet observe multiple botnets exploiting CVE-2023-1389, a vulnerability targeting TP-Link Archer AX21 (AX1800) routers.

Author: Russia
Target: Czech national railway operator České dráhy
Description: Czech transport minister Martin Kupka warn that Russia conducted ‘thousands’ of attempts to sabotage railways, attempting to interfere with train networks and signals.

Researchers from Cisco Talos warn about a global surge in brute-force attacks targeting various devices, including Virtual Private Network (VPN) services, web application authentication interfaces, and SSH services.

Author: UAC-0184
Description: The Computer Emergency Team of Ukraine (CERT-UA) warns that threat actors from the group UAC-0184 are increasingly trying to plant data-stealing malware on messaging apps used by the Ukrainian armed forces.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: L00KUPRU
Description: Researchers from Broadcom discover L00KUPRU, a new variant of the Xorist ransomware, encrypting user files with the .L00KUPRU extension.

Author: 8Base
Description: ​The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) investigates a cyberattack after threat actors breached its IT systems to steal human resources data. The 8Base ransomware operation claims responsibility for the attack.
A threat actor allegedly hacks a database holding 5.7M Argentina’s driver’s licenses, requesting a payment of $3,000 USD for whoever wishes to purchase the images of Argentine licenses.
Poland’s national prosecutor Adam Bodnar declares that nearly 578 citizens were targeted with powerful commercial spyware Pegasus between 2017 and 2022.

Author: 8Base
Description: The Atlantic States Marine Fisheries Commission (ASMFC) suffers an 8Base ransomware attack.
Cherry Health discloses a ransomware attack.

A cyber attack on the Bağcılar Training and Research Hospital in Istanbul compromises the confidential medical records, including X-ray scans and test results, taken at the hospital since 2007. It is rumored that the attackers asked for 200,000 dollars in exchange for the medical records.

Author: BlackByte
Description: Kisco Senior Living discloses a BlackByte ransomware attack.

Author: IntelBroker
Description: “IntelBroker” claims to have breached Space-Eyes, a Miami-based geospatial intelligence firm.

Author: Cerber (a.k.a C3RB3R)
Description: Researchers from Cado Security reveal that threat actors are exploiting unpatched Atlassian servers to the  CVE-2023-22518 vulnerability to deploy a Linux variant of Cerber (aka C3RB3R) ransomware.

Author: Sandworm (a.k.a. BlackEnergy, Seashell Blizzard, Voodoo Bear, APT44)
Target: Organizations across Ukraine, and Central and Eastern Europe
Description: Researchers from WithSecure uncover Kapeka, a novel backdoor that has been used in attacks against victims in Eastern Europe since at least mid-2022.

Author: Chinese threat actors
Description: Researchers from Microsoft warn that threat actors who appear to be Chinese are exploiting vulnerabilities in the OpenMetadata platform running as workloads on Kubernetes clusters to download cryptomining software onto the targeted systems.
Researchers from Zscaler observe a threat actor weaponizing a cluster of domains masquerading as legitimate IP scanner software sites to distribute "MadMxShell", a previously unseen backdoor.

Author: FIN7
Description: Researchers from Blackberry reveal that the financially motivated threat actor FIN7 targeted a large U.S. car maker with spear-phishing emails for employees in the IT department to infect systems with the Anunak backdoor.
Researchers from Kaspersky discover SoumniBot, a new banking trojan targeting Korean users using obfuscation techniques targeting the Android operating system.
LastPass warns of a malicious campaign targeting its users with the CryptoChameleon phishing kit.
Researchers from Cisco Talos reveal that select Ukrainian government networks have been infected with a malware called OfflRouter since 2015.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from McAfee discover a new info-stealing malware linked to Redline posing as a game cheat called 'Cheat Lab,' promising downloaders a free copy if they convince their friends to install it too.

Author: LockBit
Description: The Hospital Simone Veil in Cannes (CHC-SV) announces that it was targeted by a cyberattack, severely impacting its operations and forcing staff to go back to pen and paper. The LockBit ransomware operation claims responsibility for the attack.

Author: Israel?
Description: Lebanon's state internet provider Ogero comes under a 10-day cyber attack of suspected Israeli origin.

Author: Russia
Description: Researchers from Microsoft reveal that Russia’s disinformation operations around the U.S. elections have ramped up over the last month-and-a-half after a relatively slow start compared to previous cycles.

Author: CyberArmyofRussia_Reborn
Description: CyberArmyofRussia_Reborn, a group with ties to the Russian government is suspected of carrying out a cyberattack in the Muleshoe water facility that caused a tank at a Texas water facility to overflow.

Author: Threat actor with possible ties to Russia
Description: Threat actors try to unsuccessfully break into the town of Hale Center “firewall,” prompting the town to disable remote access to its SCADA system.

Author: Threat actor with possible ties to Russia
Description: Town officials in Lockney detect “suspicious activity” on the town’s SCADA system.
Extern, a social justice charity, is hit with a ransomware attack.

Author: BlackSuit
Description: The Post and Courier is hit with a BlackSuit ransomware attack.
The New York Bill Drafting Commission is taken down by a malware attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: A legitimate-looking Google Search advertisement for the crypto trading platform 'Whales Market' redirects visitors to a wallet-draining phishing site that steals all the crypto assets.

Target: Government entities in the Middle East
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky reveal the details of DuneQuixote, a previously undocumented campaign delivering a new backdoor dubbed CR4T.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Perception Point discover a phishing campaign targeting users by exploiting an open redirect vulnerability from a domain belonging to coffee connoisseur, Nespresso.

Author: Lazarus
Description: Researchers from Avast uncover a new campaign by the North Korea-linked threat actor known as Lazarus Group employing fabricated job lures to deliver a new remote access trojan called Kaolin RAT, exploiting CVE-2024-21338, as part of attacks targeting specific individuals in the Asia region.

Author: RansomHub
Description: ​American telecom provider Frontier Communications is hit by a cyberattack claimed by the RansomHub ransomware operation.

Author: GhostR
Description: GhostR, a financially motivated criminal group says it has stolen a confidential database containing 5.3 million of records that companies use for screening potential customers for links to sanctions and financial crime from World-Check.

Author: LockBit
Description: The LockBit ransomware operation claims to have stolen data from the D.C. Department of Insurance, Securities and Banking (DISB), however the agencies denies the claims, and states that the leaked data is from a third-party technology provider.

Author: Hunters International
Description: Blackstone Valley Community Health Care discloses a Hunters International ransomware attack.

Author: state-backed threat actors
Description: The MITRE Corporation says that a state-backed threat actors breached its systems (MITRE's Networked Experimentation, Research, and Virtualization Environment - NERVE) in January 2024 by chaining the two Ivanti VPN zero-days CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887.

CrushFTP warns customers in a private memo of CVE-2024-4040, an actively exploited zero-day vulnerability fixed in new versions released today, urging them to patch their servers immediately. Few days lated the U.S.  Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds the vulnerability to its catalog of exploited vulnerabilities.
Researchers from Fortinet discover a malicious PyPI package named discordpy_bypass-1.7.

Author: Sandworm (a.k.a. BlackEnergy, Seashell Blizzard, Voodoo Bear, APT44, UAC-0133)
Description: The Ukraine Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-UA) reveal that the Russian  group Sandworm aimed to disrupt operations at around 20 critical infrastructure facilities in Ukraine.

Target: Individuals actively seeking out child pornography
Description: A new malware campaign is targeting individuals who actively seek out child pornography via a malicious executable called 'CryptVPN'.

Author: BlackBasta
Description: Synlab Italia suspends all its medical diagnostic and testing services after a ransomware attack forced its IT systems to be taken offline. The BlackBasta ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.
The names and e-mail addresses of parents and teachers of 127 primary and secondary schools are leaked after Mobile Guardian, a mobile platform on students’ personal learning devices is hacked.
Valley Mountain Regional Center discloses a breach.
Token infrastructure platform Hedgey Finance undergoes two simultaneous exploits that resulted in a combined loss of $44.7 million

Author: Threat actors with ties to the Chinese government
Description: Threat actors associated with the Chinese government are believed to have hacked into Volkswagen systems in an effort to steal valuable data between 2011 and 2014.

Author: LockBit
Description: The Union Hospital in Hong Kong is hit with an alleged LockBit ransomware attack.
Researchers from G Data discover "Sharp Stealer", an infostealer focused on the gamers' community.
Researchers from Kaspersky reveal that scammers have been observed employing a sophisticated tactic to steal Toncoins (TON) from Telegram users globally.

Date Occurred: Since at least June 2020 and possibly as early as April 2019
Author: APT28 (a.k.a. Strontium, Forest Blizzard)
Target: Ukrainian, Western European and North American government, non-governmental, education and transportation sector organizations
Description: Researchers from Microsoft reveal that the notorious Russian APT28 group has been stealing credentials for years by exploiting the CVE-2022-38028 Windows Print Spooler bug and using a novel post-compromise tool known as “GooseEgg.”
Researchers from AhnLab discover a campaign distributing phishing files identical to Korean portal website login screens.

Author: TA427, a.k.a. Emerald Sleet, APT43, THALLIUM or Kimsuky.
Description: Researchers from Genians uncover a campaign by APT43 exploiting Dropbox to evade detection.

Author: Belarusian Cyber-Partisans
Description: Belarusian politically motivated hacktivists from the Belarusian Cyber-Partisans group claim to have attacked the country’s largest state-run manufacturer of fertilizers, Grodno Azot, for its alleged involvement in political repression, sanctions evasion, and human rights violations.

Author: ToddyCat
Target: Government organizations in the Asia-Pacific region
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky reveal the details of the latest campaign by the ToddyCat threat actors stealing “large volumes of data,” primarily from governmental targets in the Asia-Pacific region.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: LockBit
Target: Medios de Prevención Externos Sur SL
Description: Medios de Prevención Externos Sur SL, a  medical company servicing Spain's Guardia Civil, is hit with a LockBit ransomware attack.

Almost 2,800 patients at Catholic Medical Center may have had their files containing personal and health information exposed in a third-party "data security incident" occurred to Lamont Hanley & Associates.

Author: Threat actor with possible ties to Kimsuky
Description: Researchers from Avast uncover a campaign where North Korean threat actors have been exploiting the updating mechanism of the eScan antivirus to plant backdoors on big corporate networks and deliver cryptocurrency miners through GuptiMiner malware.

Author: CoralRaider
Target: Organizations in multiple countries, including the U.S., Nigeria, Pakistan, Ecuador, Germany, Egypt, the U.K., Poland, the Philippines, Norway, Japan, Syria and Turkey
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos discover a new ongoing malware campaign distributing three different stealers, such as CryptBot, LummaC2, and Rhadamanthys hosted on Content Delivery Network (CDN) cache domains.
Country: DE EC EG GB JP NG NO PH PK PL SY TR US

Author: Lazarus, Kimsuky and Andariel.
Description: The Korean National Police Agency (KNPA) reveal the details of a major campaign carried out by threat actors from North Korea, and targeting as many as 83 defense contractors and subcontractors, 10 of which had sensitive information stolen.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: An unidentified threat actor hacks the website of Czech News Agency (CTK) a government-owned Czech news service, and publishes a fake story claiming that an assassination attempt had been made against the newly elected Slovak president, Petr Pellegrini.
Researchers from Malwarebytes uncover a malicious ad campaign targeting Facebook users via Google search.
The Russian independent news website Meduza faces repeated attempts to disrupt its digital infrastructure.

Researchers from SonicWall discover a malware campaign using a VBA macro in a Word document to download and execute a 64-bit Rust binary. This binary employs fileless injection techniques to load a malicious AgentTesla payload.

Skanlog, the Swedish logistics company that works with Sweden’s alcohol retail monopoly Systembolagethas, is hit with a ransomware attacks and prompts warnings from the country’s sole liquor retailer that its top shelves in stores around the country may be empty by the end of the week.

Author: Cyber Army of Russia
Description: The Cyber Army of Russia claims responsibility for a cyber attack to the Tipton Wastewater Treatment Plant.
The anti-Donald Trump  super PAC Lincoln Project discloses to have lost $35,000 to a business email compromise (BEC) scam.

Author: CiberInteligenciaSV
Description: The threat group CiberInteligenciaSV releases what it says is sensitive information linked to El Salvador's state-operated bitcoin wallet Chivo, releasing source code on the criminal forum BreachForums.

Author: UAT4356 a.k.a. STORM-1849
Description: ​Cisco warns about ArcaneDoor, a campaign where a state-backed group tracked as UAT4356 has been exploiting two zero-day vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-20353 and CVE-2024-20359) in Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) and Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) firewalls to breach government networks worldwide via two malware implants dubbed Line Dancer, and Line Runner.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Zscaler discover a significant number of websites associated with fraudulent activities being hosted on popular web hosting and blogging platforms, distributing malware via SEO poisoning.

Researchers from WPScan reveal that threat actors are attempting to actively exploit CVE-2024-27956, a critical security flaw in the ValvePress Automatic plugin for WordPress that could allow site takeovers.
Researchers from Netcraft discover a campaign where threat actors are using compromised email accounts to send phishing emails containing links to PDF files hosted on Autodesk Drive.
Researchers from AhnLab discover an Infostealer strain made with Electron.

Author: BlackSuit
Description: The plasma donation company Octapharma suffers a BlackSuit ransomware attack.

Author: Medusa
Description: The Medusa ransomware group claims responsibility for a cyberattack on the servers of Northeast Ohio Neighborhood Health (NEON), a company providing healthcare services, and the exfiltration of nearly 51GB of data.

Target: Organizations in the education and government sectors in the U.S.
Description: Researchers from Veriti discover a campaign targeting the education and government sectors in the U.S. through the Agent Tesla and Taskun malware.
Researchers from Securonix reveal the details of FROZEN#SHADOW, an ongoing campaign that's leveraging phishing emails to deliver the SSLoad malware.

Researchers from ThreatFabric discover a new Android banking trojan named Brokewell that can capture every event on the device, from touches and information displayed to text input and the applications the user launches.

Researchers from Deep Instinct reveal that an unknown threat actor targeted government entities in Ukraine toward the end of 2023 using an old Microsoft Office remote code execution (RCE) exploit from 2017 (CVE-2017-8570) as the initial vector and military vehicles as the lure.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Target: Users of dating websites and applications in the U.S.
Description: The FBI publishes a warning about cyber criminals taking advantage of people’s fears about online dating by getting them to download fake “verification” sites that allow them to steal information and money.
Researchers from Akamai uncover a significant amount of highly likely malicious activity and domains purporting to be associated with the United States Postal Service (USPS).

Author: Belarusian Cyber-Partisans
Description: The website of Belarus’ main security service agency (KGB) has reportedly been down for two months following a cyberattack by Belarusian politically motivated threat actors.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: KageNoHitobito
Target: Organizations in Chile, China, Cuba, Germany, Iran, Lithuania, Peru, Romania, Sweden, Taiwan, the United Kingdom, and the United States
Description: Researchers from Fortinet reveal the details of KageNoHitobito, a new ransomware strain targeting Windows users across various countries.
Country: CL CN CU DE GB IR LT PE RO SE TW US

Target: Los Angeles County Department of Health Services
Description: ​The Los Angeles County Department of Health Services discloses a data breach after thousands of patients' personal and health information was exposed in a phishing attack impacting over two dozen employees.
Berry, Dunn, McNeil & Parker, a consulting firm with a medical data analytics business notifies more than 1 million individuals that threat actors stole their information from company servers.

Financial Business and Consumer Solutions (FBCS) warns initially 1,955,385 impacted individuals in the United States that the company suffered a data breach after discovering unauthorized access to specific systems in its network. One month later the company says over 3.2 million people have been impacted.
The California Statewide Automated Welfare System discloses that more than 19,000 online accounts may have been accessed by threat actors for nearly a year.
Designed Receivable Solutions (DRS), confirms the details of a data breach affecting 585,204 individuals.
Coffee County is hit with a cyber attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: North Korean threat actors
Description: Researchers from Securonix uncover a new ongoing social engineering attack campaign, tracked as DEV#POPPER, likely associated with North Korean threat actors, targeting developers using fake interviews to deliver a Python-based RAT.
Researchers from Okta observe a spike in credential stuffing activity against user accounts of online services.

Author: LockBit
Description: ​Canadian pharmacy chain London Drugs closes all its retail stores to contain what it described as a "cybersecurity incident." One month later the LockBit ransomware operation claims responsibility for the attack.

Researchers from McAfee uncover a novel infection chain associated with DarkGate malware, commencing with an HTML-based entry point and progressing exploiting the AutoHotkey utility in its subsequent stages.

Author: Muddling Meerkat
Description: Researchers from Infoblox discover a new cluster of activity tracked as "Muddling Meerkat", believed to be linked to a Chinese state-sponsored threat actor's manipulation of DNS to probe networks globally.

Researchers from QAX discover a new Android backdoor malware named 'Wpeeper' in at least two unofficial app stores mimicking the Uptodown App Store, a popular third-party app store for Android devices with over 220 million downloads. The malware uses compromised WordPress sites to act as relays for its actual command and control (C2) servers, acting as an evasion mechanism.
Researchers from SonicWall discover malicious Android apps masquerading as Google, Instagram, Snapchat, WhatsApp, and X (formerly Twitter) aimed to steal users' credentials from compromised devices.
Researchers from Inky discover a phishing campaign using Rich Text Format (RTF) attachment files to harvest Microsoft credentials.

Author: Ukraine’s military intelligence agency, the GUR
Description: Ukraine’s military intelligence agency, the GUR, launches a DDoS attack against the website of Russia's ruling party United Russia.
The Kansas City Scout System is taken down by a cyberattack.

Author: Russia
Description: State officials from Lithuania and Estonia blame Russia for GPS jamming of commercial flights.
Security researchers at JFrog identify three large-scale campaigns targeting Docker Hub with repositories that did not contain container images but featured malicious metadata instead.
A new campaign distributes the Latrodectus (a.k.a. Unidentified 111 and IceNova) malware using Microsoft Azure and Cloudflare lures to appear legitimate.
Panda Restaurant Group discloses a data breach after threat actors compromised its corporate systems and stole the personal information of an undisclosed number of associates.
Researchers from Kanji discover Cuckoo, a new information stealer targeting Apple macOS systems that's designed to set up persistence on the infected hosts and act as a spyware.
